## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been playing around with the Verus testnet, and I was wondering, is it limited to only a few identities, currencies, liquidity pools, and blockchains?

**AI Assistant:**
No, not at all! The Verus testnet is a full-featured, intrinsically decentralized multi-chain blockchain platform with an unlimited number of identities, currencies, liquidity pools, and blockchains. It's designed to give you a complete and unrestricted experience of the Verus ecosystem.

**User:**
That's great to know! Another question I had was, can I only access the Verus testnet through a web interface?

**AI Assistant:**
No, you have options! You can access the Verus testnet through both a GUI (Graphical User Interface) for basic operations and a command-line interface for more advanced functions. The GUI is available in the released versions of Verus Desktop, and the command-line interface is available in Verus CLI wallets. This way, you can choose the interface that best suits your needs and preferences.
Is the Verus testnet limited to only a few identities, currencies, liquidity pools, and blockchains?

No, the Verus testnet is not limited in that way. In fact, it is a full-featured, intrinsically decentralized multi-chain blockchain platform with an unlimited number of identities, currencies, liquidity pools, and blockchains.

## Signing transactions from multi-signature IDs (testnet and mainnet)
Create transaction, get raw transaction data:
 ```
verus sendcurrency <multi-signature-ID>@ '[{"address":"<destination_address>","amount":<transaction_amount>}]'
verus z_getoperationstatus <operation_id_returned_by_sendcurrency>
```
Take the raw hex transaction data provided by z_getoperationstatus to each additional wallet(s) containing the additional signing addresses/IDs:
 ```
verus signrawtransaction <raw_hex_transaction>
```
After the last necessary signature is applied, broadcast on the network using:
 ```
verus sendrawtransaction <raw_hex_signed_transaction>

Even convert currencies to others on the network without an exchange by sending to yourself and converting along the way.The new Verus testnet is a full-featured, intrinsically decentralized multi-chain blockchain platform with an unlimited number of identities, currencies, liquidity pools, and blockchains. It is accessible from the released versions of Verus Desktop and Verus CLI wallets, and it is the beginning of a new age in crypto. There are so many things you can do with Verus that you cannot with any other cryptocurrency platform, and you can try them all today.
